title: Eurovision Song Contest
content:
Sunday I watched a piece of the Dutch nominations for the [url=http://Eurovision]Eurovision Song Contest[/url]. I had to witness one of the most boring and uninspiring performance of a hardrock group of all time. Fortunately this group didn't win, no we are sending the Dutch mega pop group Treble with [url=http://www.treble.nl/treble/multimedia/video/ramaganana_2003]this song![/url]
[img]http://www.treble.nl/design/treble/images/main.19.jpg[/img]Don't be afraid lads take a closer look, aren't they pretty?

Thus now that I had lost my last believe in humanity I wanted to commit suicide but no not all was in vain: Today I read that Finland will let heavy metal group Lordi slaughter the audience of the Eurovision contest while playing [url=http://youtube.com/watch?v=3YgOHggUjhk&search=lordi]this song![/url]
[img]http://www.headbanger.hu/be/htdocs/updir/lordi.jpg[/img]
Don't judge them on their look, they can't help it, they where born this way.
So for the first time ever I'm very curious who's going to win. I'll vote for Lordi.

[img]http://www.rockidols.ru/up/upload/52-lordi-120703-28.jpg[/img]
Hell yeah! -----------------
[img]http://www.jamba.nl/storage/view/335/0/sn/Snow_Ball.gif[/img][img]http://www.jamster.com/s/jcw/img/logo_jamster_navi.gif[/img]
Jamster! rules!

title: Re: Eurovision Song Contest
content:
[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-stunned.gif[/img]
[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-stoned.gif[/img] Ramaragana? WTF?! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-barf.gif[/img]
[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-bloody.gif[/img]

Yeah, I was pretty surprised too when I heard that Lordi'll be Finland's contestant! The song isn't bad at all, I think. I just heard it the first time. Finland has never won or got very high in the Eurovision chart, I hope this year brings some better results. At least this is quite different from Finland's usual contestants..

But then again, it may be that the public doesn't understand our choice at all and we get the worst votes ever, and Treble wins. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-yawn.gif[/img]

I think Finland'll get my vote this year, too.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Eurovision Song Contest
content:
You think this song is good but you hate/dislike all other heavy metal bands? Or was that a joke and are you a longtime Treble fan? I'm not so sure anymore.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-stunned.gif[/img] -----------------
[img]http://www.jamba.nl/storage/view/335/0/sn/Snow_Ball.gif[/img][img]http://www.jamster.com/s/jcw/img/logo_jamster_navi.gif[/img]
Jamster! rules!

title: Re: Eurovision Song Contest
content:
Hehe. Nope, it wasn't a joke. I think this song was good, and I dislike Treble (heard about them first time yesterday, too).
Yet I don't still listen to heavy metal. I've ironically started to like Ramms+ein, though. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-embarrassed.gif[/img] But that's not heavy metal, I guess.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Eurovision Song Contest
content:
No it isn't heavy metal but it's very good for starters, considering I started once with this band. I think their fist album Herzeleid fits well in your taste with it's electronic sound, you should check it out if you haven't already.

Nobody else seems to be interested in the ESC, to bad, it's such an event.-----------------
[img]http://www.geocities.com/anthalerero/pic/banner_eurovision.jpg[/img]

title: Re: Eurovision Song Contest
content:
I remember some earlier Treble songs and mentions, but I thought they were pretty small.
I also heard they would compete for the Eurovision, didn't realise they had already won and everything.
I can't follow a word they're saying though, silly Dutch!

Hard rock Hallelujah wasn't as bad as I thought looking at those photographs.
Actually it was pretty decent, but not great, although I think listening and watching in a small embedded video player didn't help my judgement.
It's probably a lot better in the flesh.

I should try and catch the actual final contest on TV this year.
It's not like it's very educative, or even fair when it comes to who wins, but it was entertaining a few years back at least. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten. [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Graphics/Keen_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: Eurovision Song Contest
content:
Lordi wins! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] Wohooo!
It's unbelievable Finland's #1 even once! Great job!
I first heard the news yesterday when I was in a post office buying stamps for my postcards. As I said I need postcards to send postcards to Finland the man behind the counter asked me had I heard that Finland won Eurovision and he told they were great. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Good news.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Eurovision Song Contest
content:
I didn't expect that either. I was surprised when I found out listening to the radio. Pretty cool though.________________
[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v462/lemur821/toughyorp.png[/img]

title: Re: Eurovision Song Contest
content:
